    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int x,
              int y,
              java.awt.Color merchantColor,
              java.awt.Color tileColor,
              int index)
        Creates a new Player with the following characteristics:
        Parameters:
        x - the starting point's x-coordinate
        y - the starting point's y-coordinate
        merchantColor - the merchant's color, to be used for marking all of its merchants
        tileColor - the tile's color, to be used for marking all of its tiles
        index - id of player

    • Method Detail

      • addMerchant

        public void addMerchant()
        Adds a regular Merchant at the player's starting tile.

      • addMerchant

        public void addMerchant(Merchant m)
        Adds a merchant of any type and any location to the player's collection of merchants.
        Parameters:
        m - the Merchant to be added, containing the location and type.

      • addTile

        public void addTile(Tile t)
        Adds a tile to the player's total territory
        Parameters:
        t - Tile being added

      • placeBid

        public void placeBid(Auction a,
                     int bid)
        Places a bid in an auction for a tile on the map.
        Parameters:
        a - the auction for the desired tile.
        bid - the amount this player is willing to pay in the auction.

      • setBalance

        public void setBalance(int x)
        Sets the balance of the player
        Parameters:
        x - amount of balance being set to

        balance of the player

        public int getId()
        Returns:
        id of the player

      • getTerritory

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getTerritory()
        Returns:
        territory ArrayList of all tiles the player owns in their territory

      • getMerchants

        public java.util.ArrayList<Merchant> getMerchants()
        Returns:
        merchants ArrayList of all merchants the player owns

        merchantColor of the merchant

      • getTileColor

        public java.awt.Color getTileColor()
        Returns:
        tileColor color of the tile

      • getMerchantEdge

        public int getMerchantEdge()
        Returns:
        merchantEdge color of the border of each merchant, different colors represent different types of merchants
